meanings.definition: Make an amount or supply of something last longer by using or consuming it frugally.
meanings.sent1: She eked out her savings by only buying essentials.
meanings.sent2: The family eked out their food supplies during the winter.
meanings.sent3: He tried to eke out his snack by eating it slowly.
meanings.sent4: The candle flame eking out its last flicker before extinguishing.
meanings.sent5: The old car eking out its final miles before breaking down.

meanings.definition: Obtain or create something with great difficulty.
meanings.sent1: He eked a passing grade on the test after studying all night.
meanings.sent2: The artist eked out a living by selling paintings on the street.
meanings.sent3: She managed to eke out a smile despite feeling sad.
meanings.sent4: The team eked out a victory in the final seconds of the game.
meanings.sent5: The explorer eked out a path through the dense jungle.

meanings.definition: Manage to support oneself or make a living with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: They eked out a meager existence by working multiple jobs.
meanings.sent2: The farmer eked out a living from his small plot of land.
meanings.sent3: She tried to eke out a living as a street performer.
meanings.sent4: The family eked out a modest income by selling homemade crafts.
meanings.sent5: He eked out a living by doing odd jobs in the neighborhood.
